result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micah D. Quiroz

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:23 a.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF432, 22CF1119, 22CF1154, 22CM275.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Wright Laufenberg.  

Date and time set for FPT; VRCW. 
Atty Laufenberg makes statement; was headed toward resolution at last hearing but deft has picked up new charges.  Deft on PO hold.  Atty Laufenberg states they are willing to waive time limits for prelims on newer cases (22CF1119 and 22CF1154); requesting another pretrial date. 
ADA Mayo has no objection to waiving time limits. 
COURT finds good cause to extend time limits. 

COURT sets PTC for 11/08/22 at 2:50 p.m. 

Adj:  9:26 a.m.
Letter to CC re Reset Prelim
Preliminary Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:10 am.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 1:15 pm.
INCLUDES: 22CF1119 & 22CF1154.

Deft appears via video, in custody, pro se.  
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes Atty Wright Laufenberg has been appointed.
COURT finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Prelim set for 10/24/2022 @ 10:10 am, Courtroom B.

Adj: 1:17 pm.

Called called:  9:04 am
Clerk:  Kim H.
22CF1119 and 22CF1154
ADA Kyle R Mayo in court for State of Wisconsin by ADA Molly Lawrence.  Defendant Micah D. Quiroz in court, in custody/pro se. Court reporter Kim Lentz appears by zoom.
Date and time set for preliminary hearing.
Dft states he has an atty on other cases and wishes to have him here for this hearing. 
Court sets Review hearing for 10/7 at 1:00 pm w/ Court Commissioner
Court finds good cause to extend time limits to Friday, 10/7.
Adj. 9:06 am
Review hearing on October 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

2:23 p.m.
Clerk Micki. 

State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher.  Defendant appears in custody from the MCJ via Zoom video, with Attorney Adam Fontana.

Date and time set for initial appearance. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

COURT ORDERS: $2,000.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Dates:
PH 10/3/22 at 9:00 a.m.
FPT 10/18/22 at 9:15 a.m.

Branch 4.
